Message.Title: ARM Warning, IDF, Apple Launch, etc
Message.Msg: ARM warns of slow sales in 2H12 and DB downgrades ARMH. Possibilities: 1. Surprising in view of bulish outlook from nVidia and TSMC. May be a coordinated effort by ARM and DB to drive down stock price in order to issue employee stock option at lower strike price or some other reasons. I can't rule out this possibility. 2. Or ARM is simply teasing Intel. Somebody ridng positive publicity and perceived success gets more ideas to tease rivals. 3. Or Intel is already gaining market share in smartphones in India, China, Europe. ARM camp's manufacturing lag will only pave way for Intel. Otellini not at IDF, will not be at Apple launch event either. Whole lot of speculation is going on which I think is irrelevant. 1. A company executive is unlikely skip important internal event for symbolic presence at another company event. 2. Apple generally doesn't have supplier executives at its launch events, I believe. Also Apple doesn't announce suppliers at launch. So speculation about Otellini not having IDF keynote in favor of attending Apple event is irrelevant. 3. If at all there is reason for Otellini to be present at Apple event, there would still be no conflict with IDF. He could have keynote address on Sept 11 and still attend Apple launch event on Sept 12. Overall, linking Otellini's absence from IDF keynote to his presence at Apple event for major pro-Intel announcement is the height of optimism. Possibilities: 1. Intel wants to give way to new executives including possible CEO candidates. 2. There will possibly be negative announcement from Apple like version of Mac running on ARM chip designs, without discarding Intel altogether. So Intel doesn't want to set too much possitive tone on Sept 11 only to be embarassed on Sept 12. 3. Not much to show as achievements post IDF 2011, particularly in smartphones and tablets. So Intel wants to downplay IDF 2012. Not to say that Intel has not made any progress so far. But the progress does not show off yet, and may show off in coming months. Apple Launch Event, Sept 12: 1. One hope for Intel is Apple reverts back to Infineon for baseband processors, given Intel's process lead and ability to fill demand. But that will not be known from Apple itself on Sept 12. 2. There is unlikely to be any preannouncement of future product.

Message.Msg: It appears investors will be buying the dips as they await word from Europe and Bernanke on the extent of future monetary easing. Although traders may get what they want, be leery that they could sell the news. have a nice day.

Topic.Title: TSMC Says Only 4 Years Behind Intel

Message.Msg: From Fudzilla: TSMC has finally gotten around to announcing a roadmap for the mass-production of next-generation 10nm wafers. It seems that TSMC will have everything ready by 2018. The chipmaker delayed in making 450mm wafers, which were originally scheduled in 2015. It said that the delay was caused by semiconductor equipment suppliers’ postponement in developing advanced equipment for manufacturing amid the industrial slump. The 450mm wafers would help solve the problem of rising costs in making advanced chips, allowing TSMC to provide affordable 10 nanometer chips with FinFET transistors for customers. J.K. Wang, vice president of TSMC’s operation in charge of 300mm factories, told a media briefing that it was the cost constraints rather than technological constraints for chipmakers to migrate to next-generation chips via shrinking chip geometry, he said. Chipmakers can get 2.5 times more chips from a 450mm wafer than from a 300mm wafer. TSMC planned to build a pilot production line to make 450mm wafers between 2016 and 2017, when semiconductor ASML Holding NV had its key equipment ready in 2015, Wang said. The chipmaker would consider building major 450mm-wafer production lines in Greater Taichung, he said.

Topic.Title: TSMC Says Only 4 Years Behind Intel

Message.Msg: Note: "..it was the cost constraints rather than technological constraints for chipmakers to migrate to next-generation chips via shrinking chip geometry..." So Intel is currently ahead for business reasons. With TSMC and other independent foundries witnessing exploding demand, this business edge is likely going to reduce. Till now, demand for foundry services was really low compared to Intel's chip volume. This has changed.

Topic.Title: INTEL DROPPED BY ACER

Message.Msg: Atom-powered notebooks are and always have been a dud. Tablets have blown them away, and Intel's own Pentium CPUs are not all that much more expensive. So-called netbooks were always a dumb idea. The only positive note is that Atoms are a rounding error on Intel's bottom line. All of that said, Intel is still bereft of a real innovation plan. I'm amazed their BoD puts up with their management team.

Topic.Title: Intel to Present at Citi Tech Conference Tues 9am

Message.Msg: You can listen to the replay of the webcast on the Intel investor relations web page. There is also a copy of the presentation which is the standard (evolving) Intel tech conference presentation. The presentation ran a little long and there was only time for one question. The question was (my paraphrase): Why does the Intel forecast for server growth differ so much from the analyst estimates? Diane Bryant answer was (my paraphrase): Analysts are basing their forecast on top three companies who used to dominate the server market but their are now 10 to 15 large players like Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Facebook who are building their own servers. The analysts are not weighing the impact of these new players. Intel has previously made the same comment about PC growth and emerging markets. Since the analysts are consistently "surprised" by Intel performance, it would not be hard to figure out who knows more about the market. The analysts seem to phone Digitimes reporters for their information.

Topic.Title: INTEL DROPPED BY ACER

Message.Msg: The original Digitimes story was talking about the 10-inch "netbooks" manufactured by "notebook players". Other media did not pick up the story accurately and it makes a good negative story on the board. tooooofunnnny and aliases have posted it here several times. Intel would LOVE to have vendors use the Atom for tablet and smartphone products. It is hard to make a profilt on an Atom based netbooks when a Core i3 notebook is the same price. Intel may need to adjust roadmap for PC-use Atom processors Monica Chen, Taipei; Joseph Tsai, DIGITIMES [Monday 3 September 2012] Intel may be forced to adjust its roadmap for PC-use Atom processors as the top-2 netbook vendors – Asustek Computer and Acer – both plan to stop manufacturing related products, according to sources from notebook players. Asustek is already set to halt its Eee PC product line and officially phase out from the IT industry after completely digesting any remaining inventory. As for Acer, so far, the company has not yet made any plans to open new netbook projects, indicating that the vendor may also plan to step out of the market. Although Atom series processors will still be adopted by handset and embedded products, the sources believe the two product lines are unlikely to be able to fill the gap created by the absent netbook products in short term due to weak shipments. Asustek CEO Jerry Shen recently confirmed that the company will stop production of Eee PC netbooks using Atom-based processors such as the N2600 due to impact from tablet PCs and notebooks, as well as a sharp drop in demand in emerging markets. Asustek plans to have its Transformer tablet PCs fill the 10-inch mobile device market, replacing its netbook product line.

Message.Msg: Yeah, the 10.1" screen PC should be a tablet. Then the laptop PC's can begin at an 11.6" screen. The PC product mix should be: Atom tablet for consumers with 10.1" screen, one pound weight, WiFi, no cellular, and I would prefer an ethernet plug instead of a docking station Ivy Bridge tablet for business with 10.1" screen, one pound weight, WiFi, no cellular, encrypted hard drive, fingerprint reader, and I would prefer an ethernet plug instead of a docking station Ultrabook laptops with screen size beginning at 11.6" and weight beginning at two pounds. Then screen size going up to larger sizes and weight going up to 3.5 pounds. (And one PC maker has a carbon fiber Ultrabook.) But: The PC makers are showing hybrid tablet/laptops when an Atom PC. Then they have one-piece tablets when Win RT on ARM. So: It looks like to me that Win 8 on Atom doesn't have the expected screen refresh rate. However: If Acer is not going to have an 10.1" Atom hybrid tablet/laptop then likely they will have an 10.1" Atom one-piece tablet . And Lenovo has a 10.1" Atom tablet announced but they seem confused as they just also announced 10.1" Atom hybrid tablet/laptops and also announced Android on ARM tablets.

Message.Title: Intel announces two software development suites
Message.Msg: INtel Claimed it was just a simple directive.... work in the environment you know Now it's a whole suite of tools I told you all.... !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! CHIPMAKER INTEL announced the launch of two software development suites today, Intel Parallel Studio XE and Intel Cluster Studio XE 2013, to help software developers produce more reliable applications. The INQUIRER got the lowdown on Chipzilla's new products from Intel chief software evangelist James Reinders, who told us that the launch comes as the firm tries to "help developers find simpler errors more easily, in a bid to product fast, scalable and more reliable apps". Set to help developers improve application performance on current and next generation processors including the Intel Xeon Phi coprocessors, the development suits include new features such as improved compiler and library performance, decreased CPU power usage and low overhead Java profiling. Intel also told us that its new Parallel and Cluster Studio XE suites will come with an MPI library with improved fault tolerance and extended parallelism to include Linux, Fortan and C#. "Intel Parallel Studio XE provides advanced tools to build superior shared memory applications and Cluster Studio XE adds support for distributed and hybrid applications," the company explained. "Applications built using these tools typically run faster on computers, servers and clusters. The suites enable developers to deliver applications that perform and scale well in computers and clusters while improving productivity to create faster, more reliable applications." Intel Parallel Studio XE is available from today, while Intel Cluster Studio XE 2013 is set to arrive on Windows and Linux later this year. The software suites will fetch $1,599 to $2,299 and $2,949, respectively.

Topic.Title: Mayor of San Antonio caught LYING about job creating at the DNC

Message.Msg: A LIE is a LIE. If you want to invest a few minutes, there are a number of Democrats citing the 4.5m jobs number. You can post this for each one that uses the 4.5m number. However, CNN concludes the figure of 4.5m is accurate if you set the start date after the Bush freefall ended like the Democrats did. I don't think that Ryan indicated that he was timing from the 10-mile mark. From FACT CHECK: When Democrats use the 4.5 million jobs number, they're referring to jobs created after the economy bottomed out in January 2010, one year after Obama took office. That time frame excludes the worst job losses, which took place in 2009, and which many Democrats argue were the result of Bush policies. CNN concludes: "The figure of 4.5 million jobs is accurate if you look at the most favorable period and category for the administration. But overall, there are still fewer people working now than when Obama took office at the height of the recession."

Topic.Title: TSMC Says Only 4 Years Behind Intel

Message.Msg: Apple, Qualcomm Bids Spurned for Exclusive TSMC Supplies Apple Inc. (AAPL) and Qualcomm Inc. (QCOM) were rebuffed in separate attempts to invest cash with Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (2330) in a bid to secure exclusive access to smartphone chips, people with knowledge of the matter said. Both proposals included investments, each of more than $1 billion, for the world’s largest custom maker of chips to set aside production dedicated to making chips exclusively for them, said the people, who declined to be identified because the details are not public. Enlarge image TSMC Chairman and CEO Morris Chang Morris Chang, chairman and chief executive officer of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC). Photographer: Ashley Pon/Bloomberg Apple Patent Win Won't Reap Benefits in Long Run 5:42 Aug. 28 (Bloomberg) -- Per Lindberg, an analyst at ABG Sundal Collier Partners LLP, discusses the copyright infringement dispute between Samsung Electronics Co. and Apple Inc., and its possible impact on Nokia Oyj. He speaks with Guy Johnson on Bloomberg Television's "The Pulse." (Source: Bloomberg) The two companies are trying to satisfy booming demand for smartphones, a market estimated by to be worth $219.1 billion, according to data compiled by Bloomberg Industries. Any deal would give Apple an alternate supplier to Samsung Electronics Co. (005930), which builds the main chip used in the iPhone and iPad and is also its biggest rival in smartphones. Qualcomm needs to boost supply, since shortages are starting to limit earnings. As a supplier to Qualcomm, Broadcom Corp. (BRCM), Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) and other companies that no longer operate their own factories, TSMC wants to keep the flexibility to switch its production between customers and products. TSMC Chairman Morris Chang told investors last month that he was willing to devote one or even two factories to a single customer. “Currently we believe we still can fund it,” Chief Financial Officer Lora Ho said in an interview on July 19. TSMC wants to retain control of its plants, doesn’t want to sell part of itself and doesn’t need cash for investments, Ho said in the interview. Dedicated Fabrication Qualcomm Chief Executive Officer Paul Jacobs said in June that he was willing to write ‘big checks’ to improve supply shortages that have held back earnings growth this year. The San Diego-based company is working with multiple suppliers to improve output, he said. TSMC doesn’t comment on negotiations with customers or potential customers, spokeswoman Elizabeth Sun said. Apple spokesman Steve Dowling declined to comment on whether the company had offered cash. Clare Conley, a Qualcomm spokeswoman, declined to comment. Apple and Qualcomm are trying to improve their position in a supply chain where a shrinking number of companies are capable of churning out the millions of parts needed to meet surging smartphone demand. As they become more like computers, the advanced mobile phones need more sophisticated processors made with the latest production technology. While TSMC is Qualcomm’s biggest supplier, according to data compiled by Bloomberg, it has been successful because it has worked with multiple customers. Dedicating one facility to a single product or customer creates the risk of a fabrication plant becoming a burden if the product, client or technology changes, said Ho. “You have to be careful. Once that product migrates, what are going to do with that dedicated fab?” said Ho. “We would like to keep the flexibility.”

Topic.Title: Mayor of San Antonio caught LYING about job creating at the DNC

Message.Msg: Maybe he was counting illegal alien jobs?

Topic.Title: Mayor of San Antonio caught LYING about job creating at the DNC

Message.Msg: If FACT CHECK and CNN also counted the same way that the Mayor did, then I would say you are right. They didn't count the undocumented alien jobs. If the state, local and federal government employee jobs tracked up the same way they did under the Regan and Bush recessions, it would probably be 6.0 million jobs. Government jobs increased during both of those recessions.

Message.Title: Black and White
Message.Msg: In its recent report, "The Lost Decade of the Middle Class," the Pew Research Center found that in 1971, 62% of the country's income was earned by the middle class, which at that time represented 61% of the population. In 1991, the middle class took in 54% of the income and represented 56% of the country. In 2011, the middle class represented 51% of the population, but its earning was down to 45%. None of this would be a problem if the percentage of Americans who became rich was in line with the amount of money the rich were taking in. Unfortunately, that is not the case. In 1971, the rich represented 14% of the country and took in 29% of the income. In 2011, the rich represented 20% of the country but took in a whopping 46% of the money. [And yet the rich are still not satisfied...]

Topic.Title: Barclay's raises INTC price target to $30.

Message.Msg: The analyst thinks there is nothing to be gained but also nothing to be lost, and therefore a NEUTRAL rating would be more in line. You could buy at $24.40 and then sell call options that generate $0.25 per month while collecting the quarterly $0.225 dividend. SEPT $0.25 OCT $0.62 NOV $0.76 DEC $0.95 JAN13 $1.15 1% per month call premium plus 3% dividend = 12% + 3% or 15% annual. Seems like a NEUTRAL since he is saying low downside and 3% dividend.

Message.Title: Just A Thought
Message.Msg: The market wants to hear something concrete from ECB President Mario Draghi. Earlier in the summer his positive comments sparked a triple digit rally. This time traders want to see action. Technically the DJ Transportation Index broke the bottom trend line of a triangle pattern which is a negative for stocks. If stocks are unable to rally on comments tomorrow keep an eye on the transports. If they are unable to reverse their recent negative momentum and move back into their triangle pattern it could be an indication that the summer rally has gone as far as it can on the stimulus talk. have a nice evening
